be.libis.lias.toolbox
Class GeneralOptionsManager<T>

java.lang.Object
  be.libis.lias.toolbox.GeneralOptionsManager<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Specify an interface that inherits from GeneralOptions and which contains the application specific options.
public class GeneralOptionsManager<T>
extends java.lang.Object

This class deals with the default actions required to parse the options.

It also processes the general options specified in GeneralOptions. See processOptions() for details on usage.

processOptions

public T processOptions(java.lang.Class<T> c,
                        java.lang.String[] args,
                        java.util.logging.Logger logger)
The method that parses the command line options and deals with the general options.

In your application's main, call this method like this (with T your derived GeneralOptions interface) :

T options = new GeneralOptionsManager<T>().processOptions(T.class, args, logger);
if (options == null) return; // error messages are printed by GeneralOptionsHandler

You can then query the resulting option object for your command line options.

Parameters:
c - Class of the derived interface. This is typically T.class
args - Pass the command line arguments here.
logger - Pass the logger object you created for your application.
Returns:
a T object or null if parsing failed.

intToLevel

public static java.util.logging.Level intToLevel(int i)
Converts an integer to a Level object.
  • 0 = OFF
  • 1 = SEVERE
  • 2 = WARNING
  • 3 = INFO
  • 4 = ALL

Parameters:
i - Logging level number.
Returns:
The generated Level object or null if the number was out of range.
